question:
A company wants to run an in-memory database for a latency-sensitive application that runs on Amazon EC2 instances. The application processes more than 100,000 transactions each minute and requires high network throughput. A solutions architect needs to provide a cost-effective network design that minimizes data transfer charges.

Which solution meets these requirements?

options.A: Launch all EC2 instances in the same Availability Zone within the same AWS Region. Specify a placement group with cluster strategy when launching EC2 instances.
options.B: Launch all EC2 instances in different Availability Zones within the same AWS Region. Specify a placement group with partition strategy when launching EC2 instances.
options.C: Deploy an Auto Scaling group to launch EC2 instances in different Availability Zones based on a network utilization target.
options.D: Deploy an Auto Scaling group with a step scaling policy to launch EC2 instances in different Availability Zones.

explanation: Cluster placement groups in the same AZ provide low-latency, high-throughput networking with no data transfer charges between instances. Different AZs incur data transfer charges. Cluster strategy is ideal for HPC and in-memory databases requiring high network performance.
